item.title: Assessing the WLAN ... the dark arts of extreme digital nomading
Discussing Remote ... the book!!!
item.description: These days people look for advice and insight into how to build and run a remote-first engineering organization. And want/need to learn fast!!! One good resource is (obviously) Remote (kind of the bible on working remote). The book was published in 2013 (and was probably written in the 12 month before that). Obviously the key messages/statements from the book are still true (or truer than ever), but I think that since then things have also changed and evolved.

item.title: TEDN - The most important tool ...
item.description: … is the laptop? No (but more on this later)! … is the mobile phone (with good 4G coverage)? No (and again … more on this later)! … is a foldable coffee mug!!! When you start to work remote (from home, from any place, …) you will discover that you will end up in coffee shops (either because you want to (because you want/need to fight the cabin fever) or because you have to (because you want/need to find/have a WLAN connection)).

item.title: The Extreme Digital Nomad (TEDN)
Happy 4th of July!!! Or ... how to take advantage of an opportuunity!
item.description: A long weekend in San Francisco (Jul., 4th - Independence Day), great weather and nothing to do? I smell opportunity! Opportunity to do something that I always wanted to do: Explore the bay area on a motor bike. The Nitro CEO was kind enough to introduce me to Wolfgang and Wolfgang and his team helped me to get my hands on a BMW R1200 RT and off we go. Motorcycling in San Francisco (SF) can be tricky.
